result.execSummary:
The defendant James Walter Weyaus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Walter Weyaus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Walter Weyaus in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant James Walter Weyaus in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives joint agreement.  Attorney Klopp agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  State makes final statement.   Attorney Klopp makes final statement.  Defendant makes final statement.  Victim rights met.  Court imposes sentence.

WI State Prison for 30 months (12 months Initial Confinement/18 months Extended Supervision)  Repeater and enhancer dismissed.  Concurrent.
Submit to DNA Sample
$268.00 Costs, $250.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.

Attorney Roger L. Klopp in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances.  Atty Klopp states he talked to ADA Ryan last week re: possible resolution.  Writ needs to be done to have DE brought here from Green Bay Correctional.  Requests plea/sent.  Court advises Atty Klopp to talk to Br 3 re: plea/sent date maybe prior to the JT date that is already set.  Bond continued.

Defendant James Walter Weyaus in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant James Walter Weyaus in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial br. 3.  Bond continues.

Pre-trial conference at 10-30-2015 10:45 am.
Return date at 11-10-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant James Walter Weyaus in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant James Walter Weyaus in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Just recently appointed.  Need another PTC and RD.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant James Walter Weyaus in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant James Walter Weyaus in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states matter is resolved and states recs.  Atty Masana agrees and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea.  DE makes statement that he just wants to get this over with.  Court questions DE on issues.  Atty Masana responds and will move to withdraw and have new counsel appointed.  Court grants request by Atty Masana to withdraw and instructs that new counsel be appointed for the DE.  Matter reset.  Bond continued

  Return date scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 3.  Bond continues.

Defendant James Walter Weyaus in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant James Walter Weyaus in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana advises of waiver today.  Court goes through waiver with defendant.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Bond continues.

Court states case and appearances.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court.  Ryan addresses Court; request reset of this matter for a Return Date.  Masana agrees with reset.  Court resets matter to 08/20/2015 at 1:00 pm.  Notices provided.

Defendant James Walter Weyaus in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant James Walter Weyaus in custody.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana advises matter not resolved.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Motion and Notice of Witness List

Pre-trial conference at 06-05-2015 11:15 am.
Return date at 06-17-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant James Walter Weyaus appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $2500.00 cash bond.  Criminal history in many states.  Warrant pending in Montana.  Attorney ORourke states no objection at this time to cash bond.  Time limits waived.  $2500.00 CASH bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
